titleInfo.title: Recreation Room at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#453 JCRS Buildings, #453 JCRS Physical Plant''. On back of photograph: ''#453 JCRS Recreation Room Main Bldg 1947''.

mods.abstract: Recreation room in the main building, on the campus of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
